availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert A. Brawner (Franklin County, KY, brick and stonemason)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, brick and stonemason. Maryland native. Married to Catherine Murray Brawner. Father of Alexander Brawner, Agnes L. Brawner, Thomas Brawner, Henry K. Brawner, Lavenia Brawner, and James G. Brawner. Stonemason in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Brick and stonemason in Franklin County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 42A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 867.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 244.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 490A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 21703.
KYR-0001-020-1490.
